intro: Rennellia morindiformis, commonly known as the Rennell island morinda, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rennell in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
